decks.notes: The main concept of the deck is to quickly assemble a high storm count in order to cast a lethal Tendrils of Agony. This is achieved by using cards like Cabal Ritual, Dark Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana, while also digging for key pieces with cards like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe. Cabal Therapy and Duress are used to disrupt the opponent's hand and protect the combo. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn, ideally before the opponent has a chance to interact.

This aggro Jund deck focuses on aggressive plays and disrupting the opponent's game plan early on. With a combination of efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, the deck aims to quickly take control of the game. The inclusion of versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Kolaghan's Command helps the deck handle a variety of threats. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support these aggressive plays while also providing consistency in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is using cards like Dark Ritual, Entomb, and Reanimate to quickly bring powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Grave Titan from the graveyard onto the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide for mana acceleration, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive plays and dominate the game through powerful reanimation combos. The inclusion of Chancellor of the Annex and Thoughtseize helps to disrupt opponents' game plans and protect the combo pieces, while cards like Collective Brutality provide additional utility and flexibility in various matchups.

The deck focuses on utilizing infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, along with pump spells like Berserk and Become Immense, to quickly deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The deck's mana base consists of fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for its spells. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a swift and deadly infect combo before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Goblin creatures and overwhelming the opponent with a fast-paced offense. The deck utilizes cards like Goblin Lackey and Aether Vial to cheat creatures onto the battlefield quickly, while also providing disruption with cards like Tarfire and Pyrokinesis. The main goal is to swarm the board with Goblins, buff them up with cards like Goblin Chieftain, and deal damage to the opponent before they can establish their own strategy. The Goblins also have synergy with each other, allowing for powerful combos and overwhelming pressure on the opponent.

This deck aims to efficiently disrupt the opponent's resources while deploying threats quickly and consistently. By combining disruptive cards like Hymn to Tourach and Force of Will with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, the deck puts pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Leovold, Emissary of Trest adds additional control elements to the strategy. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's game plan and ensure smooth gameplay.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach, Force of Will, and Abrupt Decay, while also establishing a threat with Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope to further control the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Deathrite Shaman and Leovold, Emissary of Trest provide additional value and disruption to outvalue opponents in a longer game. The mana base is designed to support the various colors needed for the deck's spells and creatures.

The key concept of this deck is to play aggressively and quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cheap spells like Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Price of Progress, along with disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to maintain board control and pressure the opponent's life total. The creatures in the deck, such as Monastery Swiftspear, Delver of Secrets, Soul-Scar Mage, and Stormchaser Mage, provide a consistent source of damage and can quickly close out games.

The primary focus of this Grixis Control deck is to utilize disruptive spells and efficient creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Deathrite Shaman, the deck aims to protect its own threats while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to maintain a steady stream of resources. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to grind out value, disrupt the opponent, and eventually establish complete control over the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand while establishing a powerful board presence with efficient threats like Stoneforge Mystic and Deathrite Shaman. It also has strong removal and disruption elements like Swords to Plowshares, Fatal Push, and Thoughtseize to control the game. The inclusion of cards like Lingering Souls and Council's Judgment provide additional value and versatility. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain control of the game through a combination of disruptive spells, powerful creatures, and equipment.

The deck aims to utilize fast, efficient Eldrazi creatures and disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to overwhelm opponents in the early game. With a mana base focused on Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin, the deck can quickly deploy powerful threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The inclusion of cards like Dismember and All Is Dust provide options for removal and board wipes, while Mishra's Factory and Walking Ballista offer additional utility and flexibility. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around aggressive plays and disruption to secure victory.

The main concept of this Control Stoneblade deck is to utilize powerful disruptive spells and equipment to control the game while efficiently deploying threats and generating card advantage through card draw and token production. The deck focuses on using Stoneforge Mystic to search for key equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, while also including versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict for board control. Additionally, cards like Lingering Souls provide a recurring source of threats, making it difficult for opponents to stabilize or recover. Ultimately, the goal is to outmaneuver opponents and gain a strong advantage in card advantage and board presence.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, while disrupting their game plan with counter spells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around maintaining aggression and disruption to quickly close out games.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to establish early board presence with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and control the game tempo, utilizing its diverse land base to cast spells of all colors and maintain flexibility in its strategy. With a mix of countermagic, removal, and creature threats, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly using cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, cast multiple rituals like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to generate more mana, and then play a storm spell like Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent. The deck includes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to help dig for combo pieces, as well as disruption in the form of Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game in one explosive turn while protecting itself with various spells and cards.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient and versatile spells like Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Price of Progress. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's plans with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also maintaining card advantage and card selection through cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The creatures in the deck, such as Monastery Swiftspear, Delver of Secrets, and Stormchaser Mage, also contribute to the aggressive game plan by providing additional damage and pressure on the opponent.
